title: Information Literacy and Social Inquiry Competency Enhancement Program for Practitioners: Focusing on Historical and Political Variable Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy, information retrieval experience, introductory understanding of social phenomena (interconnectedness of history/politics/economics/culture), and awareness of fundamental civic rights
context.additional_context: A program to cultivate information analysis, evaluation, and utilization skills for enhancing the work efficiency of current practitioners. Designed with a practical focus using digital devices, including case studies utilizing social networks (SNS, public data, community networks, etc.). Emphasizes analyzing the impact of political decision-making processes and historical cases on modern societal issues.

learning_goals: Learners will critically evaluate diverse information sources to select credible materials and analyze the influence of information within social contexts (historical/political/economic/cultural).

Learners will systematically search, synthesize, and apply relevant information to workplace problems, deriving holistic solutions that consider historical/political variables and institutional relationships.
Learners will visualize and effectively communicate information analysis results using digital tools, understanding data-driven decision-making processes and citizen participation strategies.
Learners will understand and apply information ethics principles in practice, recognizing the rights and responsibilities of digital citizenship (privacy protection, fake news identification).

resources: Database Package for Information Retrieval Practice

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
